value: Plate 4, Decoration de Cheminée pour un grand Apartement

label: Description
value: A mantelpiece, slightly projecting with a mirror above. Upper part of frame embellished with scrollwork, female mask and two birds. Tapestries decorating adjoining paneling. Below, profile of wall molding with legend. Inscribed along lower margin: "Decoration d'une Cheminée, pour une Salle ou Cabinet d'assemblée, tendu de tapisseries"; lower right: "Mariette excudit"; upper left: 4".

label: Provenance
value: Cooper Union Museum Library, New York, NY; 1959: transferred to Museum
Dessin de Lambris d'une chambre a coucher avec lit en niche
Panelling of the Assembly Room in Palais Bourbon

label: Description
value: View of the wall with three windows in shallow niches. Panels between them with mirrors. Paneling above windows and mirrors with scroll decoration with small trophies. Inscribed, upper margin: "Decoration du Lambris du côté des croisées du grand cabinet ou Salle d'assemblée du palais de Bourbon"; lower right: "Mariette exc."

label: Provenance
value: Cooper Union Museum Library, New York, NY; 1959: transferred to Museum
Title Page from "Second Licre Contenant Differens Desseins de Pendules Inventés par G. M. Oppenort Architecte du Roi et Gravés par Huquier"

label: Description
value: An oval frame set into a rectangular framework with curved top and bottom. The upper part decorated with a profile portrait in a medallion. The lower part supported by a masque and flanked by two dragons. Inscribed in the oval frame, title; lower margin: "A Paris chez Huquier au coin de la rue des Mathenins"; upper left: "B"; upper right: "1".

label: Provenance
value: Cooper Union Museum Library, New York, NY; 1959: transferred to Museum
Decoration of the Entrance Hall in Hotel Roquelaure

label: Description
value: Elevation of the wall with a double door in center. The semi-circular overdoor decorated with hunting trophies. The paneling with decorated bottoms and tops. Decoration consists of slim acanthus volutes, shells, flower-vases. Inscribed, upper margin: "Decoration du côté de la porte d'entrée de la precedent. Antichambre de l'Hotel de Roquelaure"; lower right: "Mariette excu".

label: Provenance
value: Cooper Union Museum Library, New York, NY; 1959: transferred to Museum
Decoration of the Fireplace Wall in Entrance Hall of Hotel Roquelaure

label: Description
value: Elevation of a wall with fireplace in the middle, flanked by double doors. Paintings on overdoors and mantelpiece. Panels between doors and fireplace decorated with acanthus scroll, shell, and flower basket carvings. Inscribed, upper margin: "Decoration du côté de la Cheminée d'une Antichambre de Hotel de Roquelaure A Paris du dessein de M. le Roux Architecte"; lower right: "Mariette exc."

label: Provenance
value: Cooper Union Museum Library, New York, NY; 1959: transferred to Museum
Decoration of the Bedroom Fireplace Wall at Hotel Roquelaure

label: Description
value: An elevation of a wall with a fireplace in center, flanked by double doors. Fireplace with a mirror with a voluted top. Paintings on overdoors. Panels decorated with scroll pattern at the ends and in center. Inscribed, upper margin: "Decoration du côté de la Cheminée de la Chambre à coucher de l'Hotel de Roquelaure, du dessein de M. le Roux Architecte"; lower right: "Mariette exc."

label: Provenance
value: Cooper Union Museum Library, New York, NY; 1959: transferred to Museum

label: Description
value: Book illustration. Within framing lines is seen a half-length figure of a soldier in right profile, rifle and fixed bayonet at his side. Behind, other figures in high silk hats, and silhouetted above rocks, in right background, are two hanged men.

label: Physical description
value: Brush and black ink, white gouache on brown paper

label: Credit line
value: Gift of Mrs. Robert I. Aitken

label: Description
value: On molded foot a bell-shaped body with heavy gadrooning on lower part. Flaring neck and mascaroon handles. Underglaze cobalt lambrequin and scroll decoration at neck and foot. Body shows floral swags and a large coat-of-arms with three stag antlers (attires) below crossed keys, crested by five-point crown, helmet and four-de-lis, helbard, flags and smoking cannons. All on vertical hatching indicating the color red (gules).

label: Description
value: A white cup and saucer with a gilt lined rim on both. Each have a painted ship in black with gilt initials on the sails.

label: Dimensions
value: H x W x diam.: 7 x 9.5 x 7 cm (2 3/4 x 3 3/4 x 2 3/4 in.) H x diam. (saucer): 3.4 x 14.7 cm (1 5/16 x 5 13/16 in.)

label: Description
value: Length of woven silk satin in bright green with repeating symmetrical sheild-shaped ornament in pale yellow down the center.

label: Physical description
value: Medium: silk Technique: satin patterned by continuous supplementary weft

label: Description
value: Yellow-green damask with a large-scale symmetrical abstract pomegranate shape enclosing a single fleur-de-lys. Height of repeat was probably about 24 inches.

label: Dimensions
value: a) Warp x Weft: 114 x 61 cm (44 7/8 x 24 in.) b) Warp x Weft: 119 x 65 cm (46 7/8 x 25 9/16 in.)

label: Description
value: A frame with inner corners chamfered in curves and decorated with scroll-work and panels showing stylized leaves.

label: Credit line
value: Gift of Mrs. Henriette B. Bonaventure

label: Description
value: Tooled and engraved, contained in small box printed with C. E. Gifford and Co., Fall River, Mass. In script, on scrap of paper: Grandmother Gifford's sleeve-buttons.

label: Provenance
value: Donor states buttons worn by his great grandmother.

label: Description
value: Bust portrait of Vasco Nuñez de Balboa (1475-1517), framed by intertwining snakes and flanked by American Indian man and woman with child, a llama, puma, and monkeys among trees. Probably used for printing of a title page.

label: Provenance
value: James Hazen Hyde; 1960: acquired by Museum

label: Credit line
value: Gift of the Estate of James Hazen Hyde

label: Description
value: (a) Asia figures and trophies surmounted by Amor or a love putto; (b) Africa, foliate scrolls above an heraldic cartouche surrounded by quivers and flgures below.

value: James Hazen Hyde; 1960: acquired by Museum

value: Gift of the Estate of James Hazen Hyde

label: Description
value: (a) Asia figures and trophies surmounted by Amor or a love putto; (b) Africa, foliate scrolls above an heraldic cartouche surrounded by quivers and flgures below.

label: Provenance
value: James Hazen Hyde; 1960: acquired by Museum

label: Credit line
value: Gift of the Estate of James Hazen Hyde

label: Description
value: Scrolled square frame with animal allegories of the Four Continents: camel, horse, lion and monkey; hinged quadrant, hour circle with gnomon and pendulum; in center, recessed circular box with compass needle, the face engraved with mermaid and triton; set on three adjustable legs.

label: Physical description
value: Gilt and engraved brass, cut and blued steel, glass

label: Provenance
value: James Hazen Hyde; 1960: acquired by the Museum

label: Credit line
value: Gift of the Estate of James Hazen Hyde

label: Notes
value: Scrolled square frame with animal allegories of the Four Continents: camel, horse, lion and monkey; hinged quadrant, hour circle with gnomon and pendulum; in center, recessed circular box with compass needle, the face engraved with mermaid and triton; set on three adjustable legs.

label: Description
value: Oval fragment representing "Asia" shows a seated man in a turban and loose robe. Behind him is blue fringed tent panel and two camels. He carries a scepter and a sword rests near his feet. In shades of red, blue, brown and off-white. Probably a detail from a table cover.

label: Credit line
value: Gift of the Estate of James Hazen Hyde

label: Description
value: Oval fragment representing "Europe" shows a seated female figure, crowned and holding a scepter. Behind her is a panel of red drapery and a rearing horse. Grapes and other fruits are by her feet. In shades of red, blue, brown and off-white.  Probably a detail from a table cover.

label: Credit line
value: Gift of the Estate of James Hazen Hyde

label: Description
value: Oval fragment representing "Africa" shows a draped female figure with a striped hat and spear. Bow and quiver rests near her legs. Just beyond her is an elephant, and in the far background are tent-like structures and palm trees. In shades of red, blue, brown and off-white. Probably a detail from a table cover.

label: Credit line
value: Gift of the Estate of James Hazen Hyde

label: Description
value: Oval fragment representing "America" shows a seated indigenous male figure in a feathered headdress and skirt. He wears a heavy necklace and armbands on his upper arms. A parrot is perched on his right hand, and the left hand holds an arrow. Just beyond him lies a puma. In shades of red, blue, brown and off-white. Probably a detail from a table cover.

label: Physical description
value: Medium: wool, silk Technique: tapestry weave

label: Credit line
value: Gift of the Estate of James Hazen Hyde

label: Description
value: Panel in gadrooned frame.  Female figure, swinging censer, seated in chariot drawn by two camels; in background, a battle scene against the backdrop of a hill town. At top right, labeled "Asia".

label: Provenance
value: James Hazen Hyde; 1960: acquired by Museum

label: Credit line
value: Gift of the Estate of James Hazen Hyde

label: Notes
value: Panel in gadrooned frame. Female figure, swinging censer, seated in chariot drawn by two camels; in background, a battle scene against the backdrop of a hill town. At top right, labeled "Asia".

label: Description
value: Panel in gadrooned frame. Female figure, crowned, holding sceptre and orb, seated under laurel wreath in chariot, drawn by a pair of horses; in background, grazing cattle and a burning castle. At top right, labeled "Europa".

label: Provenance
value: James Hazen Hyde; 1960: acquired by Museum

label: Credit line
value: Gift of the Estate of James Hazen Hyde

label: Notes
value: Panel in gadrooned frame. Female figure, crowned, holding sceptre and orb, seated under laurel wreath in chariot, drawn by a pair of horses; in background, grazing cattle and a burning castle. At top right, labeled "Europa".

label: Description
value: Panel in gadrooned frame. Nude female figure, holding tambourine and feather parasol, seated in chariot with crocodile arm rests, drawn by two lions; in foreground, scaly quadruped; in background, two elephants, camel, lion and ostrich. At top right, labeled "Africa".

label: Provenance
value: James Hazen Hyde; 1960: acquired by Museum

label: Credit line
value: Gift of the Estate of James Hazen Hyde

label: Notes
value: Panel in gadrooned frame. Nude female figure, holding tambourine and feather parasol, seated in chariot with crocodile arm rests, drawn by two lions; in foreground, scaly quadruped; in background, two elephants, camel, lion and ostrich. At top right, labeled "Africa".

label: Description
value: Panel in gadrooned frame. Semi-nude female figure with feather headdress, holding bow and sceptre, seated in chariot drawn by two unicorns; in foreground, an armadillo in background, men with bows inside and outside a circular enclosure.  At top right, the word "America" is faintly visible.

label: Provenance
value: James Hazen Hyde; 1960: acquired by Museum

label: Credit line
value: Gift of the Estate of James Hazen Hyde

label: Notes
value: Panel in gadrooned frame. Semi-nude female figure with feather headdress, holding bow and sceptre, seated in chariot drawn by two unicorns; in foreground, an armadillo in background, men with bows inside and outside a circular enclosure. At top right, the word "America" is faintly visible.

label: Description
value: Lobed oval, on scrolled feet, with four-lobed relief medallions of the Four Continents; engraved decoration.

label: Provenance
value: Estate of James Hazen Hyde; 1960: acquired by Museum

label: Credit line
value: Gift of the Estate of James Hazen Hyde

label: Description
value: a) Bowl with engraved strapwork and four-lobed medallions. Shaped relief-cast handles, also with medallions. B) Domed cover, with strapwork-engraved gadrooned sides and small medallions; on top, medallion with Africa, surrounded by engraving; three scrolled feet.

label: Provenance
value: James Hazen Hyde; 1960: acquired by Museum

label: Credit line
value: Gift of the Estate of James Hazen Hyde

label: Description
value:
Helmet-shaped ewer on domed foot, engraved with strapwork, and bearing lobed medallions in two sizes, the larger representing Asia and America, the smaller Geometry, Music, etc.  Double-scrolled handle.
The basin is marli alternately lobed and straight, with guilloche band, strapwork engraving, and four large relief medallions representing the Four Elements, and four smaller medallions of the Four Continents.  Gadrooned well; raised center with relief medallion of Hercules crowned by Victory, framed in guilloche border and strapwork.

label: Dimensions
value: a) H: 27 x L: 23.3 x W: 11.2 cm b) H: 6 x  Di: 52.6 cm

label: Provenance
value: Gift of the Estate of James Hazen Hyde  Bought from Ball in Berlin, Germany, 12/1930 (price: 15.000 Marks)

label: Credit line
value: Gift of the Estate of James Hazen Hyde

label: Description
value: Hunting trophy consisting of bow, two lances, helmet, club, drum, animal skin and tambourine, suspended by sash.

label: Provenance
value: James Hazen Hyde; 1960: acquired by Museum

label: Credit line
value: Gift of the Estate of James Hazen Hyde

label: Description
value: Silver-gilt American Indian, in feather skirt and headdress, holding up globular glass cup, engraved with coat of arms, two gentlemen shaking hands, and legend: "Treuer Freunde Freundschafts Pflicht Endert Sich im Grabe nicht."

label: Dimensions
value: H x diam. (goblet): 25.9 x 12.8 cm (10 3/16 x 5 1/16 in.) H (Indian figure): 15.3 cm (6 in.)

value: Gift of the Estate of James Hazen Hyde
